depressie.title: Depression
depressie.subtitle: Depression is more than just feeling sad. It's a serious mood disorder that affects how you feel, think, and handle daily activities.
depressie.description: Depression is more than just feeling sad. It's a serious mood disorder that affects how you feel, think, and handle daily activities such as sleeping, eating, or working. Everyone feels sad or down sometimes, but with depression, these feelings persist for longer periods and are more intense.

what_is_depression.title: What is depression?
what_is_depression.content: Depression is a common but serious mood disorder. It causes severe symptoms that affect how you feel, think, and handle daily activities, such as sleeping, eating, or working. To be diagnosed with depression, the symptoms must be present for at least two weeks.

major_depression.title: Depressive episode
major_depression.content: A depressive episode is characterized by persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest in activities for at least two weeks. Other symptoms may include feelings of worthlessness, concentration problems, changes in appetite or sleep, and thoughts of death.

types.title: Different forms of depression
types.content: Depression can manifest in various ways and symptoms may vary in intensity and duration. Recognizing the type of depression is important for appropriate treatment.

major_depression.title: Major depressive disorder
major_depression.description: The most common form of depression, characterized by depressed mood or loss of interest in activities for at least two weeks.

persistent_depression.title: Persistent depressive disorder
persistent_depression.description: A form of depression that lasts for at least two years. Symptoms may vary in intensity during this period.

bipolar_disorder.title: Bipolar disorder
bipolar_disorder.description: Characterized by alternating periods of depression and mania (elevated mood). The depressive episodes are similar to those of major depressive disorder.

seasonal_depression.title: Seasonal depression
seasonal_depression.description: A form of depression that occurs at the same time each year, usually in fall or winter when there is less natural sunlight.

postpartum_depression.title: Postpartum depression
postpartum_depression.description: A serious form of depression that can occur after childbirth. It's more than the 'baby blues' and can affect a mother's ability to care for herself and her baby.

psychotic_depression.title: Psychotic depression
psychotic_depression.description: A form of severe depression accompanied by psychotic symptoms such as hallucinations, delusions, or paranoia.

treatments.title: Treatment Forms
treatments.description: At Groeipunt we use various scientifically proven treatment methods for depression. Which treatment is used depends on your specific situation and the severity of the depression.

testimonial.quote: The treatment at Groeipunt helped me come out of the dark period of my depression. They gave me the tools to break through my negative thought patterns.

angst.title: Anxiety
angst.subtitle: Anxiety is a feeling everyone knows: being startled by a fast approaching car or being afraid of taking an important exam. Anxiety exists to protect us from danger and is therefore important. However, it often happens that people become afraid faster than necessary.
angst.description: Anxiety is a feeling everyone knows: being startled by a fast approaching car or being afraid of taking an important exam. Anxiety exists to protect us from danger and is therefore important. However, it often happens that people become afraid faster than necessary.

what_is_anxiety.title: What is anxiety?
what_is_anxiety.content: Anxiety is important because it protects us from danger. However, sometimes people become afraid faster than necessary. People can be afraid of many different things. When you are often afraid without clear danger or cause, you may start avoiding situations or places. This can lead to a worsening of anxiety, taking over your life and eventually developing into an anxiety disorder. About 1 in 4 people will experience an anxiety disorder at some point in their life.

panic_disorder.title: Panic Disorder
panic_disorder.content: People suffering from panic disorder regularly experience panic attacks and are afraid of new attacks. During a panic attack you recognize symptoms such as faster heartbeat, hyperventilation, feelings of restlessness, dizziness and trembling or sweating. The feeling may arise that you are losing control of yourself.

agoraphobia.title: Agoraphobia
agoraphobia.description: Agoraphobia is an anxiety that arises when you come to public places, such as squares, supermarkets or public transport. Avoiding these places can take such serious forms that you no longer dare to leave the house.

health_anxiety.title: Health Anxiety Disorder
health_anxiety.description: People with health anxiety disorder, also called hypochondria, are afraid that they have a serious illness. Even when doctors find nothing and they have been thoroughly examined, they continue to worry too much about their health.

ocd.title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
ocd.description: People with obsessive-compulsive disorder can suffer from obsessive thoughts and/or compulsive behaviors. Obsessive thoughts are thoughts or images that keep coming back and cause anxiety.

social_anxiety.title: Social Anxiety Disorder
social_anxiety.description: People with social anxiety disorder are very afraid of other people's reactions or criticism. They may worry that others will laugh at them or think they are weird, unkind or boring.

generalized_anxiety.title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
generalized_anxiety.description: Generalized anxiety disorder is also called worry disorder. Someone with generalized anxiety disorder worries seriously about everyday things for a long time.

specific_phobias.title: Specific Phobias
specific_phobias.description: Specific phobia encompasses an essentially endless series of phobias that can relate to all possible objects and situations.

treatments.title: Treatment Forms
treatments.description: At Groeipunt we use various scientifically proven treatment methods. Which treatment is used depends on your complaints and personal situation.

testimonial.quote: Therapy at Groeipunt helped me overcome my social anxiety disorder. They helped me recognize my standard thought processes and triggers.

adhd.title: ADHD
adhd.subtitle: ADHD (Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder) can present in multiple ways in adults.
adhd.description: ADHD can cause difficulties with attention, impulsivity and/or hyperactivity. In adults this may affect work, relationships and daily functioning.

what_is_adhd.title: What is ADHD?
what_is_adhd.content: ADHD is a neurodevelopmental condition that affects attention, impulsivity, and sometimes hyperactivity. Symptoms vary per person and life stage. Diagnosis and treatment aim to reduce symptoms and improve functioning.

types.title: Presentations of ADHD
types.subtitle: ADHD has different presentations that affect daily life.
types.content: ADHD presents differently across individuals and symptoms can vary from person to person. Recognizing the type of ADHD is important for effective treatment.

inattentive.title: Predominantly inattentive
inattentive.description: Difficulty sustaining attention, easily distracted, trouble completing tasks.

hyperactive.title: Predominantly hyperactive-impulsive
hyperactive.description: Restlessness, impulsive actions and difficulty sitting still or waiting.

combined.title: Combined presentation
combined.description: A combination of both attention and hyperactivity/impulsivity symptoms.

treatments.title: Treatment options
treatments.description: Treatment for ADHD often includes psychoeducation, coaching, behavioral strategies and, when appropriate, medication. Treatment is tailored to individual needs.

testimonial.quote: Getting a clear diagnosis and practical coping strategies made daily life manageable again.

trauma.title: Trauma & PTSD
trauma.subtitle: Trauma can follow distressing events and have lasting effects on functioning and emotion.
trauma.description: Trauma includes reactions to events where one's safety or integrity was seriously threatened. Treatment focuses on restoring safety and reducing trauma-related symptoms.

what_is_trauma.title: What is trauma?
what_is_trauma.content: Trauma arises after a shocking or threatening event and can lead to long-lasting symptoms such as re-experiencing, hyperarousal, and avoidance.

types.title: Types of trauma
types.subtitle: Trauma can be acute, complex, or develop into PTSD.

ptsd.title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
ptsd.description: Persistent symptoms like re-experiencing, nightmares and heightened irritability following trauma.

acute.title: Acute stress reaction
acute.description: A direct response to a traumatic event, often temporary but intense.

complex.title: Complex trauma
complex.description: Repeated or prolonged traumatic experiences that deeply affect functioning.

treatments.title: Treatment options
treatments.description: Treatments include EMDR, trauma-focused CBT and stabilization training, tailored to the client's capacity.

testimonial.quote: Therapy helped me process my memories and regain control of my life.

somatiek.title: Somatic & Psych
somatiek.subtitle: Somatic issues concern physical complaints that are connected with psychological factors.
somatiek.description: Somatic complaints are physical symptoms for which no full medical explanation is found; emotional or psychological factors often contribute to their maintenance.

what_is_somatiek.title: What is somatic (somatiek)?
what_is_somatiek.content: Somatic complaints are physical symptoms without a complete medical explanation. Stress, tension or emotional factors often play a role in maintaining these complaints.

types.title: Common somatic complaints
types.subtitle: Examples where physical and psychological factors interact.
types.content: Here we discuss some common somatic complaints and how psychological factors may contribute to them.

pain.title: Chronic pain
pain.description: Pain complaints without a fully explanatory medical cause, often with an important psychological component.

fatigue.title: Chronic fatigue
fatigue.description: Long-lasting fatigue that impairs daily functioning and is not fully explained by somatic illness.

functional_symptoms.title: Functional symptoms
functional_symptoms.description: For example gastrointestinal complaints, dizziness or palpitations without a clear physical cause.

treatments.title: Treatment options
treatments.description: Treatment may include psychoeducation, graded activity, cognitive behavioral approaches and collaboration with somatic specialists, tailored to capacity and symptom profile.

testimonial.quote: Therapy helped me manage my physical symptoms better and regain routine in daily life.

zelfbeeld.title: Self-image issues
zelfbeeld.subtitle: Problems with self-image can seriously affect functioning and wellbeing.
zelfbeeld.description: Self-image issues include negative beliefs about oneself, body image concerns and low self-esteem. Treatment focuses on building self-worth and breaking maladaptive patterns.

what_is_zelfbeeld.title: What is self-image?
what_is_zelfbeeld.content: Self-image refers to how you see and evaluate yourself. Negative self-image can lead to withdrawal, perfectionism and mood problems.

types.title: Forms of self-image issues
types.subtitle: Different presentations of low self-esteem and body image concerns.
types.content: We describe common forms such as low self-esteem, social insecurity and body image problems.

low_self_esteem.title: Low self-esteem
low_self_esteem.description: A persistent sense of insecurity about one's abilities and worth.

body_image.title: Body image problems
body_image.description: Negative perception of one's body that leads to shame or avoidance.

treatments.title: Treatment options
treatments.description: Treatments can include cognitive behavioral therapy, schema therapy, body-focused therapy and self-worth training.

testimonial.quote: Therapy helped me improve my self-image and gain more confidence.

persoonlijkheid.title: Personality issues
persoonlijkheid.subtitle: Problems rooted in long-standing personality patterns that affect relationships and functioning.
persoonlijkheid.description: Personality issues refer to persistent patterns of thinking, feeling and behaving that cause distress or impairment. Treatment often focuses on long-term change, mentalization, schema work and interpersonal strategies.

what_is_persoonlijkheid.title: What are personality issues?
what_is_persoonlijkheid.content: Personality issues involve enduring patterns of thinking and behaving that can make relationships and everyday functioning harder. These patterns often develop early in life and can be resistant to change without targeted therapy.

types.title: Common personality-related problems
types.subtitle: Different presentations that may benefit from specialized therapy.
types.content: Personality-related problems can include rigid interpersonal styles, difficulties regulating emotions, and maladaptive coping strategies.

avoidant.title: Avoidant patterns
avoidant.description: Severe social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy and hypersensitivity to negative evaluation.

dependent.title: Dependent patterns
dependent.description: Excessive need to be taken care of, submissive behavior and fear of separation.

borderline.title: Emotionally unstable / Borderline patterns
borderline.description: Instability in relationships, self-image and affect with impulsive behaviors; benefits from dialectical and schema-focused approaches.

treatments.title: Treatment options
treatments.description: Treatment may include schema therapy, dialectical behavior therapy (DBT), mentalization-based treatment (MBT) and long-term psychotherapeutic work tailored to the individual's needs.

testimonial.quote: Long-term therapy helped me understand and change old patterns. I now handle relationships and emotions much better.

voor-wie.title: Who we are here for
voor-wie.subtitle: Our care is available for everyone who needs professional psychological help.

who_we_help.title: Who we help
who_we_help.content: Our practice offers specialized care for adults with various mental health concerns. We are here for everyone seeking help.

adults.title: Adults (18+)
adults.description: Professional treatment for all adults with mental health concerns such as anxiety, depression, trauma and more.

first_time.title: First time seeking help
first_time.description: Even if this is your first time seeking psychological help, we are happy to guide you through the process.

returning.title: Recurring concerns
returning.description: Have you had help before and are experiencing concerns again? We will help you continue where you left off.

urgent.title: Urgent situations
urgent.description: For acute problems, we ensure quick intake and appropriate support.

when_to_seek_help.title: When to seek help
when_to_seek_help.content: Not sure if professional help is needed? These signals may indicate it's time to reach out.
when_to_seek_help.symptom_1: You experience persistent mental health concerns that affect your daily functioning
when_to_seek_help.symptom_2: You have difficulty regulating your emotions and thoughts
when_to_seek_help.symptom_3: Your social relationships or work are negatively affected by your concerns
when_to_seek_help.symptom_4: You notice that self-help and support from loved ones are no longer sufficient

contact.title: Wondering if you need help?
contact.description: Feel free to contact us for a non-committal conversation about your situation.

intake-behandelplan.title: Intake & Treatment Plan
intake-behandelplan.subtitle: A careful start to your treatment with personal attention and professional guidance.

process.title: Our process
process.content: We follow a structured approach to ensure you receive the best care that matches your specific needs.

step1.title: First contact
step1.description: By phone or online, we schedule an appointment and discuss your care request generally.

step2.title: Intake interview
step2.description: Comprehensive conversation where we map out your concerns, background and goals.

step3.title: Treatment plan
step3.description: Together we create a personal treatment plan that matches your needs.

step4.title: Start treatment
step4.description: We begin treatment according to the agreed plan with regular evaluations.

what_to_expect.title: What to expect
what_to_expect.content: We ensure you are well prepared and know what to expect throughout the entire process.

intake.title: During intake
intake.description: A safe environment where you can tell your story and ask all your questions.

plan.title: Your treatment plan
plan.description: A customized plan with clear goals and an appropriate treatment method.

preparation.title: Preparing for your intake
preparation.content: Good preparation helps you get the most out of your intake interview and ensures an efficient start to your treatment journey.
preparation.tip1: Think about what you want to achieve with treatment
preparation.tip2: Make notes about your concerns and when they started
preparation.tip3: Bring a list of medications you are taking
preparation.tip4: Prepare questions you would like to ask

wachttijden.title: Current Waiting Times
wachttijden.subtitle: Transparent information about our current waiting times for different treatments.

note.title: Note
note.description: Waiting times may vary per therapist and type of treatment. We always keep you informed.

factors.title: What affects waiting times
factors.factor1: Type of treatment and therapist specialization

while_waiting.title: While waiting
while_waiting.description: While waiting for your treatment, you can take some steps:
while_waiting.tip1: Keep a diary of your concerns and triggers
while_waiting.tip2: Stay in touch with your family doctor
while_waiting.tip3: Seek temporary support from family or friends
while_waiting.tip4: Look for self-help groups in your area

urgent_contact.title: Need urgent help?
urgent_contact.description: For serious concerns or crisis situations, you can contact us directly for emergency intake.

registration_cta.title: Register or refer?
registration_cta.description: Want to know how to register yourself or refer a client to Forta Adults? Check out our registration information.

vergoeding.title: Reimbursement & costs
vergoeding.subtitle: Clear information about treatment costs and what is reimbursed by your insurance.

covered.title: Treatment fully covered
covered.description: Psychological treatment is covered by basic insurance and is fully reimbursed after your deductible.

sessions.title: Number of sessions
sessions.description: Basic insurance covers all necessary treatment sessions without a maximum number.

referral.title: Referral required
referral.description: You need a referral from your GP to qualify for reimbursement.

amount.title: €385 per year (2024)
amount.description: You first pay your deductible. After that, your insurance reimburses 100% of the costs.

additional_insurance.title: Additional insurance
additional_insurance.description: Some insurers offer extra reimbursement for psychological help through additional insurance.

psychology.title: Additional psychology
psychology.description: Extra reimbursement for treatment by psychologists without referral.

alternative.title: Alternative therapies
alternative.description: Reimbursement for additional treatment forms such as EMDR or mindfulness.

step1.title: Direct billing
step1.description: We bill directly with your health insurer. You don't need to arrange anything yourself.

step2.title: Deductible
step2.description: You only pay your deductible, we settle the rest directly with your insurer.

step3.title: Transparent costs
step3.description: You always receive clear information about all costs and reimbursements in advance.

contact.title: Questions about reimbursement?
contact.description: We are happy to help you with questions about insurance and costs. Feel free to contact us.

contact.title: Ready to start?
contact.description: Contact us for an intake or ask your question directly.

over-ons.title: About Us
over-ons.description: Learn more about Groeipunt, our locations, team and quality standards.

locaties.title: Our Locations
locaties.description: Groeipunt Adults is located in various places in the Netherlands. Below you will find the address, contact details and current waiting times for each location.

team.title: Our Team
team.description: Meet our dedicated professionals who are committed to your mental wellbeing. Our multidisciplinary team consists of experienced specialists who work together to provide the best care.

kwaliteit.title: Quality
kwaliteit.description: Learn more about our quality standards, certifications and continuous improvements.
kwaliteit.intro: All care we provide within our care programs is reimbursed by your health insurer. We need a referral letter from your (family) doctor plus your insurance details, BSN (citizen service number) and a valid identity document.

keurmerk.title: Basic Mental Health Quality Mark
keurmerk.description: At Groeipunt we strive for high-quality care and we are proud to be a quality mark holder in Basic Mental Healthcare since 2016. This is the mark for quality in Basic Mental Healthcare. As a care provider, we show that we go beyond the legal requirements when it comes to client focus, transparency and implementation of innovations. Evaluating our services, continuously improving treatments and commitment to national development in Basic Mental Healthcare are an integral part of this. We actively participate in meetings around the Basic Mental Healthcare Quality Mark.

hkz.title: HKZ
hkz.description: Groeipunt is HKZ certified. The HKZ quality mark shows that Groeipunt meets the quality requirements set by clients, the government, the mental healthcare sector and health insurers. This has been established by an independent certification body. The quality mark provides a basic guarantee for quality. A certified institution has organized its work in such a way that all conditions are met to deliver optimal care. The client's perspective is always the starting point.
hkz.subtitle: The HKZ Quality Mark means that an organization:
benefits: Puts the client at the center
Has its internal affairs well organized
Continuously works on optimizing care and service delivery

statuut.title: Quality Statute
statuut.description: Groeipunt has an approved Mental Healthcare Quality Statute. To view it, click here.

contact.title: Questions about our quality care?
contact.description: Contact us for more information about our quality standards, certifications and improvement programs.

questions.title: Questions?
questions.description: For registration, more information or help, you can contact Groeipunt Adults directly via:

office_hours.description: We are available by phone during office hours from Monday to Friday, from 08:30 to 16:30 at

appointment.title: Unable to attend your appointment?
appointment.description_1: We ask you to cancel at least
appointment.description_2: in advance by phone or email at
appointment.email_requirements: Always include your name, date of birth, phone number, appointment date and reason for cancellation in your email. Without this information we cannot cancel the appointment.
appointment.careful_scheduling: We ask you to handle appointments carefully and only cancel them in extreme cases. Switching to video calling is always possible.

warning.title: Note: Canceling appointment within 48 hours
warning.description: When the appointment is canceled or rescheduled less than 48 hours in advance or you don't show up for the appointment, costs will be charged.

appointment.emergency: For emergencies outside office hours, you can contact your GP or the GP post.

contact_info.title: Contact information
contact_info.office_hours: We are available by phone during office hours from Monday to Friday, from 08:30 to 16:30
contact_info.lunch_break: Due to lunch break, we are limited available by phone between 12:30 - 13:30.
contact_info.emergency: For emergencies outside office hours, you can contact your GP or the GP post.

locations.title: Our locations
locations.description: Curious where Groeipunt is located? View the overview of all our locations, including contact details and waiting times.
